alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 1:41AM CDT until May 19 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Washita County in western Oklahoma... Northwestern Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southeastern Custer County in western Oklahoma... Southwestern Blaine County in northwestern Oklahoma... * Until 230 AM CDT. * At 141 AM CDT, the leading edge of winds from a line of severe thunderstorms was located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Weatherford to 5 miles southwest of Bessie to 3 miles east of Retrop, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Clinton, Cordell, Burns Flat, Geary, Hydro, Sentinel, Arapaho, Dill City, Corn, Eakly, Bessie, Rocky, Colony, Bridgeport, Alfalfa, Cloud Chief and Cowden. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
